revised_title: Circulation of Blood in Vermes: A Comparative Study with Higher Classes
tldr: The author, Everard Home, examines the unique circulation of blood in the Vermes class of Linnaeus, highlighting differences from higher animal classes. He describes the central role of a small "heart" and the muscular structure of branchial vessels in facilitating circulation. The study also compares the blood circulation and aeration in Lumbricus terrestris and Sepia, revealing similarities and differences with other animals.
